$Harry Danning threw to Lou Chiozza, who dropped the ball; HP umpire George Magerkurth called Augie Galan for interference with the throw; as play was about to resume lots of equipment flew out of the Cubs dugout; Cubs manager Charlie Grimm announced he was playing game under protest1938NY1.EVN.regular.comment.csv"

Protest=H $Giants manager Bill Terry protested at the start of the game that the Cardinals roster still had 25 players; rosters had dropped to 23 the previous night; Commissioner Kenesaw Landis had refused to allow the Cardinals to release to Rochester Roy Henshaw and Si Johnson; Landis had granted the team a grace period; Terry claimed that he had not gotten any such notice1938NY1.EVN.regular.comment.csv"

$Dick Bartell dropped the popup; Ival Goodman scored while the Giants pulled what looked like a 654 double play to end the inning without a run; the umpires then ruled that the infield fly was in effect and Harry Craft was out, Goodman's run counted and no runners were out since there was no force in effect; the Giants protested the game1938NY1.EVN.regular.comment.csv"
